description: Explore parts of this Grade II listed former Victorian primary school in Clerkenwell, once the HQ of Zaha Hadid Architects and now home to the Zaha Hadid Foundation.  There will be displays, free curator talks and a model-making workshop for all ages.

events.name: Drop in: Open Day
events.notes:
Please let us know if you plan to visit. Doing so allows
                    the venue to plan ahead and you will be notified by email
                    about any changes to the programme that might affect your
                    visit.

factsheet.heading: Curators talks (at 11.30am and repeated at 1pm)
paragraphs: We will host a short, curator-led talk on Zaha Hadid and the Zaha Hadid Foundation. It is repeated and take place at these times: 11.30am and 1pm. Drop-in and free, seats are available on a first come, first served basis.

factsheet.heading: Model-making workshop (drop in, 11am to 3pm)
paragraphs: What is in a city? A city is more than just buildings and roads. It is a vibrant place where people live, work and play. Join us for a fun and creative model making workshop where participants will design and build models of their favourite buildings, spaces or places. Together, we will combine everyoneâ€™s creations to build a unique city, imagined by you and open for all to explore. Suitable for adults and children from age 7 and for all abilities.

Colouring sheets featuring buildings designed by Zaha Hadid Architects will be available for younger children. All materials will be provided. These creative activities are drop-in throughout the day and available on a first come, first served basis.

factsheet.heading: Explore the building and its history (self guided)
paragraphs: Most of the building is normally closed to the public. For Open House, the ground floor of our building will be open for self-guided tours between 11am and 3pm. A new display of material and images on the building's past history as a school and the international HQ of Zaha Hadid Architects, will be opened to celebrate ZHF taking part in Open House.

factsheet.heading: Building history
paragraphs: This Queen Anne-style building is Grade II listed and was opened in 1874 for the School Board for London as Bowling Green Lane School. The building was designed by E.R. Robson in collaboration with J.J. Stevenson. It retains much of its original Victorian layout and exterior. In the 1970s it ceased operating as a school and in the 1980s it was divided up into artists' studios. It was once the international headquarters of Zaha Hadid Architects, beginning in 1985 when Zaha Hadid took up one of these studios. Her practice grew until it took over the whole building. Since 2022, it has been the home of the charity Zaha Hadid Foundation which is returning the building to educational uses through public exhibitions, research and a public programme of events.

factsheet.heading: Photography
paragraphs: Personal photography for non-commercial use is allowed. Filming or audio recording is not allowed.

factsheet.heading: Last entry
paragraphs: Last entry is 10 minutes before we close.

factsheet.heading: Food and drink
paragraphs: There are seats inside the building and we have a picnic table in the courtyard which visitors can use. People are welcome to eat or drink onsite except in the Gallery.

factsheet.heading: Children
paragraphs: All ages are welcome and we will have free creative activities for all ages. Children under 12 years of age must be accompanied by an adult at all times.
